main event: A spherical object 15" in diameter, white in color, was observed at 30' elevation and 300' above the ground in Las Vegas, Nevada on 10 Jan 1954. The object appeared stationary for 3 minutes before disappearing.
interesting points: The object was observed by a reliable witness with eleven years of service as an Air Force pilot.
The observation happened during the day with scattered clouds, and the weather station confirmed the presence of a weather balloon in the area at the time of the sighting.
While there was no discernible trail or sound from the object, it was confirmed to be a balloon released from Nellis AFB, resolving the unidentified sighting.

The report also mentions a separate newspaper article about a bright flash in the sky seen across three states, identified as a meteor by astronomers, further emphasizing celestial rather than unidentified origins of the sightings in the area.
Numerous aircraft were in the area at the time with no other reports of unidentified aircraft, adding to the conclusion that the observed object was a weather balloon.
witnesses: reliable observer with Air Force pilot experience
